intro: Dicrastylis fulva f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale in color. It thrives in wet or seasonally wet environments, often found in swamps or along waterways. Its botanical structure is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
